newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Unilever on verge of Nordsee sale - paper.
newsitem.headline: Unilever on verge of Nordsee sale - paper.

text.p: The German subsidiary of Anglo-Dutch group Unilever is on the verge of selling its Nordsee German fish business to investment firm Apax Partners, Dutch newspaper Het Financieele Dagblad said on Saturday.
It quoted an Apax spokesman as saying: "We do not expect to complete negotiations this week, but possibly next week."

The price tag for Nordsee, which is Germany's leading fish business, has been put at some 200 million sterling. It is made up of three divisions -- frozen fish products, fish restaurants and retail, and a wholesale unit. Het Financieele Dagblad said it had 6,000 employees and a turnover of 1.1 billion marks.
The newspaper made no mention of the price under discussion.

Rumours of a possible sale of the Nordsee unit surfaced in February, with the move linked to Unilever's known strategy of hiving off underperforming units. Chairman Niall FitzGerald has talked about giving the multinational a sharper focus.
